intro: Eriogonum angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands, sagebrush steppe, and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. Eriogonum angustifolium plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is often used in native plant landscaping.
